      • getUpdateManager

        public final UpdateManager getUpdateManager()
        Get the UpdateManager, this object handles all the objects that will be updated.
        Returns:
        The UpdateManager object

      • checkAll

        public void checkAll()
        Check for updates. This will check for updates on all update objects

      • check

        public void check(Updatable u)
        Check for updates on an Updatable object. If the object is already scheduled to update after restart, or scheduled to update at a later time, then nothing happens.
        Parameters:
        u - The updatable object to check for updates on

      • getUpdate

        public Update getUpdate(Updatable u)
                 throws IOException
        Get the next compatible version up for this Updatable object. If no update is found, then this method will return null.
        Parameters:
        u - The Updatable object to retrieve the update for.
        Returns:
        An Update object
        Throws:
        IOException - If there is an error getting the updates.

      • hasUpdate

        public boolean hasUpdate(Updatable u)
                  throws IOException
        Check to see if the Updatable object has any updates.
        Parameters:
        u - The updatable object to check
        Returns:
        True if updates are ready, false if no updates exist
        Throws:
        IOException - If there was an error checking for updates.

        Update an Updatable object.
        Parameters:

        public void forceUpdate(Updatable u)

        Parameters:

      • forceUpdate

        public void forceUpdate(Updatable u,
               boolean notify)
        Force an Updatable object to update to the latest version is has to offer.
        Parameters:
        u - The Updatable object to update
        notify - Whether to notify the server or not

      • forceUpdate

        public void forceUpdate(Updatable u,
               Update update,
               boolean notify)
        Force an Updatable object to update to the Update update specified in the parameter.
        Parameters:
        u - The Updatable object to update
        notify - Whether to notify the server or not

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Description copied from interface: Tick
        This is called whenever the system ticks. You should handle any unhandled exceptions in this method, if to many exceptions are raised in this tick, then it will be removed from the system tick.
        Specified by:
        tick in interface Tick

      • addToRestartQueue

        public void addToRestartQueue(Updatable u,
                     Update object,
                     UpdateType type)
        Add an Update object to the restart queue. This will update the object the next time the server starts up.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to add.
        type - The UpdateType of the Updatable object

      • addToRestartQueue

        public void addToRestartQueue(Updatable object,
                     Update update)
        Add an updatable object to the restart queue. This will update the object the next time the server starts up.
        Parameters:
        object - The object to add.

      • isInRestartQueue

        public boolean isInRestartQueue(Updatable object)
        Check to see if an updatable object will update after a restart.
        Parameters:
        object - The object check.
        Returns:
        True if it is, false if it isn't.

      • isInRestartQueue

        public boolean isInRestartQueue(String name)
        Check to see if a URL is in the restart queue
        Parameters:
        dlurl - The URL to check
        Returns:
        True if it is, false if it isn't.

      • inSeperateThread

        public boolean inSeperateThread()
        Description copied from interface: Tick
        Weather or not to run this tick object in a separate thread
        Specified by:
        inSeperateThread in interface Tick
        Returns:
        returns true if it will run in a separate thread, otherwise it will return false.

      • getTimeout

        public int getTimeout()
        Description copied from interface: Tick
        How many milliseconds each tick is separated by, where 1000 is 1 second and 60000 is 1 minute.
        Specified by:
        getTimeout in interface Tick
        Returns:
        The amount of milliseconds to wait before calling the Tick.tick() method again.

      • tickName

        public String tickName()
        Description copied from interface: Tick
        Get the name of this tick. This will be the name will appear in exception stackTraces when an unhandled exception occurs. The name of the current thread will also be renamed to this by calling Thread.setName(String)
        Specified by:
        tickName in interface Tick
        Returns:
